summary: This is an email from an unidentified sender ('C') to Diane regarding confirmation of received invitations for clients represented by Gloria, in the context of a DOJ event concerning Epstein victims. It appears to be administrative coordination related to victim participation.

persons.name: Diane
persons.context: The recipient of the email, presumably a staff member or contact at an office, being asked to confirm receipt of invitations.

persons.name: Gloria
persons.context: Represents clients (presumably Epstein victims) who were sent invitations to a DOJ event.

connections.description: Gloria represents clients who are presumably Epstein victims invited to a DOJ event.
C is communicating with Diane to coordinate invitation confirmations for a DOJ event.

events.title: DOJ Invite Coordination
events.description: Email correspondence regarding confirmation of received invitations for Epstein victims represented by Gloria to a DOJ event.

keyFacts: The email is dated October 27, 2020, indicating ongoing administrative activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
It references a DOJ event or invitation process specifically for Epstein victims.
An attorney or representative named Gloria is involved, representing clients who are presumably victims.
The correspondence is administrative, focusing on confirming receipt of invitations, suggesting organized victim outreach by the DOJ.
